teo.isgci.gui

Class PSFontMetrics

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.FontMetrics
      • teo.isgci.gui.PSFontMetrics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PSFontMetrics
extends java.awt.FontMetrics
    FontMetrics of the Postscript fonts Helvetica and ISGCIFont.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • cw

        static int[] cw
        Helvetica characterwidth. Actual width is calculated by cw[charcode]*font.getSize()/1000

      • specialcw

        int[] specialcw
        Characterwidth of ISGCIFont 'a' to 'g'

    • Constructor Detail

      • PSFontMetrics

        public PSFontMetrics(java.awt.Font font)
        Creates the fontmetrics for a given font.

    • Method Detail

      • getAscent

        public int getAscent()
        Gets the font ascent. The font ascent is the distance from the base line to the top of most Alphanumeric characters. Note, however, that some characters in the font may extend above this height.
        Overrides:
        getAscent in class java.awt.FontMetrics
        See Also:
        FontMetrics.getMaxAscent()

      • getDescent

        public int getDescent()
        Gets the font descent. The font descent is the distance from the base line to the bottom of most Alphanumeric characters. Note, however, that some characters in the font may extend below this height.
        Overrides:
        getDescent in class java.awt.FontMetrics
        See Also:
        FontMetrics.getMaxDescent()

      • charsWidth

        public int charsWidth(char[] data,
             int off,
             int len)
        Returns the printed of the characters data[off] to data[off+len-1]
        Overrides:
        charsWidth in class java.awt.FontMetrics
        Parameters:
        data - the array of characters to be measured
        off - the start offset of the characters in the array
        len - the number of characters to be measured from the array

      • stringWidth

        public int stringWidth(java.lang.String s)
        Returns the printed width of the given string
        Overrides:
        stringWidth in class java.awt.FontMetrics
        Parameters:
        s - the string to be measured.

      • charWidth

        public int charWidth(char ch)
        Returns the advance width of the specified character in this Font. The advance width is the amount by which the current point is moved from one character to the next in a line of text.
        Overrides:
        charWidth in class java.awt.FontMetrics
        Parameters:
        ch - the character to be measured
        See Also:
        stringWidth(java.lang.String)
